citeinfo.origin: Kansas Department of Health and Environment and U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Kansas Surface Water Register - Major Classified Streams

descript.abstract: The Monitoring and Analysis Unit monitors water quality conditions in streams and publicly owned lakes and wetlands throughout Kansas. This Section also tracks environmental contaminant levels in fish and other aquatic life and performs special water pollution investigations in cooperation with the KDHE district offices and other governmental agencies. The Kansas Surface Water Register spatail dataset is provided to the public as a portion of the Kansas Open Records Act (KORA).http://maps.kdhe.state.ks.us/kswatermonitor/ links to the KS Surface Water Monitoring Interactive Map.http://www.kdheks.gov/befs/download/Current_Kansas_Surface_Register.pdf links to the most recent Kansas Surface Water Register. The Kansas Department of Health and Environment is responsible for designating uses of surface waters as a part of establishing surface water quality standards. Designated uses are listed in the Kansas Surface Water Register and adopted by reference in regulation (K.A.R. 28-16-28d). A use attainability analysis (UAA) is a procedure to evaluate water bodies and assign designated uses. The federal regulations (40 CFR 131.10) allow a State to designate a use without conducting a UAA, but a UAA must be conducted to remove a designated use.
descript.purpose: This data set includes only the streams that are included in the December 2010 Kansas Surface Water Register and is a subset of the dataset "Hydro_Waterbodies.lyr". The NHD was clipped at the state boundary and an unique identifier, PROJECT_NAME, was added to the NHD from the Kansas Surface Water Register.
descript.supplinf: The Kansas Department of Health and Environment is responsible for designating uses of surface waters as a part of establishing surface water quality standards. Designated uses are listed in the Kansas Surface Water Register and adopted by reference in regulation (K.A.R. 28-16-28d). A use attainability analysis (UAA) is a procedure to evaluate water bodies and assign designated uses. The federal regulations (40 CFR 131.10) allow a State to designate a use without conducting a UAA, but a UAA must be conducted to remove a designated use.

theme.themekt: U.S. Department of the Interior, U.S. Geological Survey, 1997, Standards for National Hydrography Dataset(http://mapping.usgs.gov/standards/)

place.placekt: U.S. Department of Commerce, 1977, Countries, dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, and their principal administrative divisions (Federal Information Processing Standards 10-3): Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology.

idinfo.useconst:
Kansas Department of Health and Environment - Bureau of Environmental Field Services (KDHE-BEFS) should be acknowledged as the data source for the Kansas Surface Water Registry information. U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) should be acknowledged as the data source for the National Hydrography Data.
Data is current as of publication date. KDHE is not responsible for database integrity following download and publication. To be used at a minimum scale of 24,000. Contact KDHE for more information.

cntperp.cntorg: Kansas Department of Health and Environment; Bureau of Environmental Field Services

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

attracc.attraccr: According to the NHD: "The accuracy of the attributes of the Digital Line Graph data is estimated to be 98.5 percent. One or more of the following methods were used to test attribute accuracy: manual comparison of the source with hardcopy plots; symbolized display of the digital line graph on an interactive computer graphic system.

srcinfo.srccontr: Digital Source of Kansas State Boundary

procstep.procdesc: The National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) was created by the U.S. Geological Survey. For further information on the creation of the NHD, please refer to the entire NHD metadata. The metadata could be accessed at http://gisdasc.kgs.ku.edu/.

Utilizing the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) as a base map, the NHD was clipped at the Kansas State boundary so to include only those streams that fall within Kansas's jurisdiction. (If further extent of hydrology is needed, please refer to the contact information.) CUSEGA fields were added to the NHD database. The CUSEGA field is the unique identifier that will allow the NHD to be spatially joined with the Kansas Surface Water Register. The CUSEG field is the HUC 8 Cataloging Unit combined with the SEGment number of the stream. The CUSEG is the primary cataloging unit for all correspondence with each individual stream segment. Each year, the Kansas Legislature and EPA approves of any changes to the Kansas Surface Water Register. These changes are then transferred to this copy of the NHD.
Attribute fields from the original NHD have also been removed. This copy of the NHD only includes the most commonly used attributes in the NHD for ease of use.

Errors have be found in the original NHD due to technology constraints at the time the NHD was digitized. A majority of the changes are segment start and ending points occurring on double sided streams. Some stream rerouting has also occurred since the publication of the NHD. Stream rerouting has caused HUC changes and CUSEGA changes. These changes have been corrected in this copy of the NHD currently used by KDHE. For specific areas of changes, contact KDHE- Bureau of Environmental Field Services.
Water area land boundaries were also added to reflect those outstanding national resource waters that were not designated as water bodies on the NHD, however, are designated as protected water resources on the Kansas Surface Water Register. These changes have been corrected in this copy of the NHD currently used by KDHE. For specific areas of changes, contact KDHE- Bureau of Environmental Field Services.

KDHE Bureau of Environmental Field Services (BEFS) released the updated Water Register in December 2006. This updated table was linked to the NHD. There have been numberous designated use changes due to Use Attainability Analysis (UAA) surveys completed in the last year.

KDHE Bureau of Environmental Field Services (BEFS) released the updated Water Register in April 2007. There have been numberous designated use changes due to Use Attainability Analysis (UAA) surveys completed in the last year.
BEFS has updated the register. Mainly removed 2 stream segments & updated numerous Use Classifications.
BEFS has updated the register. Mainly removed 5 stream segments & updated numerous Use Classifications.
BEFS has updated the register. Mainly removed 5 stream segments & added 3 streams & updated numerous Use Classifications. Was finally passed in Feb of 2010.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: primary cataloging unit for all correspondence with each individual stream segment.
attr.attrdefs: Calculated from the 8 digit HUC number and the 1-4 digit segment number.

attr.attrdef: Stream name as it appears on the 2004 Kansas Surface Water Register
attr.attrdefs: May differ from the NHD stream name derived from GNIS

overview.eaover:
This dataset includes the attribute information from the 2004 Kansas Streams from the Kansas Surface Water Register.
For the Designated Uses: X = referenced stream segment is designated for the indicated beneficial use O= referenced stream segment does not support the indicated beneficial use blank = capacity of the referenced stream segment to support the indicated beneficial use has not been determined by use attainability analysis

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This data set includes only the streams that are included in the December 2010 Kansas Surface Water Register and is a subset of the dataset "Hydro_Waterbodies.lyr". The NHD was clipped at the state boundary and an unique identifier, PROJECT_NAME, was added to the NHD from the Kansas Surface Water Register.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Monitoring and Analysis Unit monitors water quality conditions in streams and publicly owned lakes and wetlands throughout Kansas. This Section also tracks environmental contaminant levels in fish and other aquatic life and performs special water pollution investigations in cooperation with the KDHE district offices and other governmental agencies. The Kansas Surface Water Register spatail dataset is provided to the public as a portion of the Kansas Open Records Act (KORA).

http://maps.kdhe.state.ks.us/kswatermonitor/ links to the KS Surface Water Monitoring Interactive Map.

http://www.kdheks.gov/befs/download/Current_Kansas_Surface_Register.pdf links to the most recent Kansas Surface Water Register.

The Kansas Department of Health and Environment is responsible for designating uses of surface waters as a part of establishing surface water quality standards. Designated uses are listed in the Kansas Surface Water Register and adopted by reference in regulation (K.A.R. 28-16-28d). A use attainability analysis (UAA) is a procedure to evaluate water bodies and assign designated uses. The federal regulations (40 CFR 131.10) allow a State to designate a use without conducting a UAA, but a UAA must be conducted to remove a designated use.

Consts.useLimit:
Kansas Department of Health and Environment - Bureau of Environmental Field Services (KDHE-BEFS) should be acknowledged as the data source for the Kansas Surface Water Registry information. U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) should be acknowledged as the data source for the National Hydrography Data.
Data is current as of publication date. KDHE is not responsible for database integrity following download and publication. To be used at a minimum scale of 24,000. Contact KDHE for more information.
